entry.title: Lycorma meliae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the wings of Lycorma meliae (example pictured) undergo multiple color changes throughout their lives?

entry.title: DeLancey W. Gill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite having no professional training or experience, DeLancey W. Gill was appointed to take thousands of photographs for the Smithsonian Institution?

entry.title: UCLA Bruins won the NCAA Division I basketball championship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John Wooden's UCLA Bruins won the NCAA Division I basketball championship in his last game as head coach?

entry.title: Sarah Cox (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sarah Cox brought the first breach of promise suit in Australia, during which she was represented by her future husband William Wentworth?

entry.title: Monster Hunter Now (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that players of Monster Hunter Now have just 75 seconds to defeat large monsters?

entry.title: a sinkhole opened up in Massachusetts in September 2023 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a sinkhole opened up in Massachusetts in September 2023, damaging cars?

entry.title: The Potato King of Colorado (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "The Potato King of Colorado" survived a shipwreck, mined for gold in Australia, and helped establish an alcohol-free Methodist colony?

entry.title: Brontosaurus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Brontosaurus stamp led to the United States Postal Service being accused of "fostering scientific illiteracy"?
